intro: Erica umbelliflora, commonly known as the coastal heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in umbels. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal environments. Erica umbelliflora is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
